variants.Description in input context: This variant causes a deletion of one codon (Pro85del), which results in a loss-of-function effect on the p53 protein.

Material used.Description: The HEK293 cell line was transfected with either the wild-type or mutant p53 plasmid DNA.

Readout description.Result Description: Immunoblot analysis showed a significant decrease in p53 protein expression for the mutant plasmid DNA compared to the wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in duplicate for technical reproducibility.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type p53 plasmid DNA served as a positive control for normal p53 protein expression.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or an irrelevant plasmid served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA with Tukey's post hoc test was used to compare the mean p53 protein expression levels among the different experimental groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: p53 protein expression greater than 80% of wild-type level.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: p53 protein expression less than 50% of wild-type level.
